alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 4:43PM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches in the Siskiyou Mountains and 16 to 28 inches in the Southern Oregon Cascades. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes, Willamette Pass Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Lake of the Woods, and Siskiyou Summit. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Stronger winds Monday could cause blowing and drifting snow and significantly reduced visibility. Snowfall rates of one half to 1 inch per hour will be common. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
